name: Appalachian Development Highway System
objective: To provide a highway system which, in conjunction with other federally-aided highways, will open up areas with development potential within Appalachia where commerce and communication have been inhibited by lack of adequate access.
applicant_types: State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: Open 25 miles of ADHS to traffic 10.9 miles completed

authorizations.text: Appalachian Regional Development Act of 1965, Section 201, Public Law 89-4, as amended, 40 U.S.C. 14501.

rules_regulations: The ARC Code (available at www.arc.gov); "Appalachian Regional Commission Project Guidelines" (also available at www.arc.gov); applicable State Appalachian Plans and Guidelines;  Performance and Accountability Reports, no charge.
